meanings.definition: To heat (something) again after an initial heating.
meanings.sent1: After baking the cake, she had to postheat it to make sure it was fully cooked.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to postheat the metal to bend it into the desired shape.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful chef accidentally postheated the soup twice, making it extra hot!
meanings.sent4: His anger postheated as he listened to the rude comments.
meanings.sent5: The sun postheated the sand, making it too hot to walk on barefoot.

meanings.definition: The act of heating something again after an initial heating.
meanings.sent1: The postheat of the leftovers made them taste even better the next day.
meanings.sent2: The postheat of the engine helped it run more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The postheat of the coffee machine was a welcome sound in the quiet office.
meanings.sent4: The postheat of the argument lingered in the room long after they had left.
meanings.sent5: The postheat of the fire kept them warm on the chilly evening.
